questions.question: He and his wife ……………………….. arrived.
questions.description: Two or more singular nouns connected by and take a plural verb.

questions.question: Oil and water ……………………… not agree.
questions.description: Two or more singular nouns connected by and take a plural verb.

questions.question: My mentor and benefactor ………………………. no more.
questions.description: When two singular nouns refer to the same person, we use a singular verb.

questions.question: The secretary and the chairman ……………………………. present at the meeting.
questions.description: Here the articles used with the two nouns indicate that they refer to different people and hence we use a plural verb.

questions.question: Each person …………………………. a vote.
questions.description: We use a singular noun and a singular verb after each.

questions.question: Each day ………………………… its own challenges.
questions.description: We use a singular noun and a singular verb after each.

questions.question: Neither Rahul nor Rohan ………………………… passed the exam.
questions.description: The verb is singular when two or more singular nouns are connected by nor.

questions.question: Either Peter or James ………………………. left his umbrella in the classroom.
questions.description: The verb is singular when two or more singular nouns are connected by or.

questions.question: Neither the manager nor his personal assistants ……………………… there.
questions.description: When the subjects joined by or or nor are of different number, the verb is plural. In this case, put the plural subject close to the verb.

questions.question: Neither he nor I ………………………… responsible for this.
questions.description: When the subjects connected by or or nor are of different persons, the verb agrees in person with the nearest subject.

questions.question: Neither you nor he ………………………… a good student.
questions.description: When the subjects connected by or or nor are of different persons, the verb agrees in person with the nearest subject.

questions.question: Everyone of them ……………………… there.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after every and everyone.
